intro: Hackelia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, red or purple berries that are typically consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
